newsitem.title: INDIA: Morgan Stanley names India chief operating officer.
newsitem.headline: Morgan Stanley names India chief operating officer.

text.p: Investment bank Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday it has appointed Vikram Gandhi as the chief operating officer of Morgan Stanley India.
He will take up his new position in Bombay in January, the company said in a statement.
Gandhi is at present an executive director in the Financial Institutions Group of Morgan Stanley's investment banking department in New York, it said.

The statement said Morgan Stanley is currently involved in infrastructure finance in the telecom, power and refining sectors. These sectors will have an estimated capital requirement in excess of $25 billion over the next five to six years, it added.
